entries.title: A Giant Balloon Was Spotted in Montana. It’s All Anyone Can Talk About.
entries.description: A Chinese balloon has been raising a lot of questions for people who live under its path. “I did see it, and it should have been shot,” said a barbecue chef in Billings, Mont.

entries.title: What Weapons Is Ukraine Getting, and Will They Arrive in Time?
entries.description: Kyiv has been promised scores of tanks and other armor, and the longest range munitions yet. But with a looming Russian offensive, a race is on to get the matériel to the battlefield.

entries.title: Chinese Spy Balloon or ‘Civilian Device’? Here’s What We Know So Far
entries.description: Here is what we know about the balloon.

entries.title: Metal Detector Hobbyist Finds a 500-Year-Old Pendant Linked to Henry VIII
entries.description: Researchers say the jewelry, found in a field outside Birmingham, England, is an extraordinary piece of treasure.

entries.title: Fears of Russian Nuclear Weapons Use Have Diminished, but Could Re-emerge
entries.description: Nearly a year into the war in Ukraine, U.S. policymakers and intelligence analysts have more confidence that they understand at least some of President Vladimir V. Putin’s red lines.

entries.title: Gary Glitter Is Released From Prison After Serving Half of His Sentence
entries.description: The disgraced former glam rock singer was found guilty in 2015 of sexually abusing three young girls in the 1970s. He had been given a 16-year sentence.

entries.title: Missing From Czech Spa Town Popular With Russians: Russians
entries.description: Since the 18th century, Russians have flocked to the healing waters of Karlovy Vary. Now, the Czech government has barred them from visiting the country, and the town must reinvent itself.

entries.title: Italian Mobster, 16 Years on the Lam, Found Working at a Pizzeria
entries.description: Edgardo Greco, 63, was arrested as he was about to start a night shift at a restaurant in France. Investigators identified him through online photographs.

entries.title: U.S. Detects Suspected Chinese Spy Balloon Hovering Over Northwest
entries.description: The revelation comes days before Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s visit to Beijing, where he is expected to meet with President Xi Jinping.

entries.title: Germany to Allow Export of Older Leopard 1 Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: An older model than the already approved Leopard 2, the tanks will need refurbishment and could face ammunition shortages.

entries.title: Suspected Spy Balloon Hampers China’s Efforts to Ease Tensions With U.S.
entries.description: Beijing said it was looking into reports about an object seen flying over Montana. “Speculation and hype will not help,” a Chinese government spokeswoman said.

entries.title: Man Convicted of Treason Over Threat to Kill Queen With Crossbow
entries.description: The conviction, the first on such a charge in Britain in more than 40 years, came after officers stopped a man at a gate leading to the monarch’s private quarters on Christmas Day in 2021.

entries.title: Symbolic Support Is Likely as Zelensky Meets With E.U. Leaders
entries.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky wants commitments for Ukraine’s membership in the bloc, but diplomats and officials say that concrete announcements are unlikely.

entries.title: Why Eggs Cost So Much
entries.description: Inflation, avian flu and war have made a food staple much more expensive.

entries.title: Hong Kong To Give Away 500,000 Plane Tickets to Lure Tourists
entries.description: The city’s reputation has been hammered by protests, a harsh security law and strict Covid measures. It hopes a giveaway of 500,000 plane tickets woos back tourists.

entries.title: Corporate Lawyer’s Unlikely Mission: Defend and ‘Humanize’ a Hated Terrorist
entries.description: Stanislas Eskenazi volunteered with Brussels’ legal aid service, typically helping petty criminals. But now he is representing Belgium’s most-wanted man.

entries.title: A New Approach to Funding for the Arts
entries.description: A new government policy, called Revive, will prioritize Indigenous arts and culture, and also provide funding for commercial arts forms, like popular music.

entries.title: Pope Francis Visits South Sudan to Highlight Young Nation’s Troubles
entries.description: The soaring hopes at South Sudan’s creation in 2011 have been cruelly dashed. Pope Francis arrives there with other religious leaders on Friday to highlight its plight.

entries.title: Your Friday Briefing
entries.description: Russian losses in the war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Court Dismisses Guilty Plea by Australian Tennis Star Nick Kyrgios in Assault Case
entries.description: The guilty plea and dismissal stemmed from a confrontation Mr. Kyrgios had with his partner in 2021 when she tried to prevent him from leaving a ride-hailing car.

entries.title: As Russia Strikes Ukrainian Civilians, Putin Tells His People the War Is Just
entries.description: Invoking World War II on the 80th anniversary of victory at Stalingrad, Mr. Putin repeated his false justifications for an invasion that has taken a staggering toll.

entries.title: Biden Aims to Deter China With Greater U.S. Military Presence in Philippines
entries.description: U.S. officials say they are preparing to surge forces in the event of conflict with China, including over Taiwan, but do not intend to build up permanent bases.
